intro: Meibomia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, simple opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Meibomia stricta often grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
